      This method is used to setup the exposure mode EXP_MODE_FIXED=0,not recommended EXP_MODE_AUTO=2

      This method is used to setup the illumination/aimer mode LM_ILLUM_AIMER_OFF=0, // Neither aimers or illumination used during scanning LM_AIMER_ONLY=1, // Aimer only used during scanning LM_ILLUM_ONLY=2, // Illumination LEDs only used during scanning LM_ILLUM_AIMER=3, // Alternating aimer & illumination during scanning (default)

        The method is used to establish a connection to the decoder library. This method must be called before any other method

        The method is used to terminate the connection to the decoder library.

      • MultiReadCallback

        public boolean MultiReadCallback(byte codeID,
                        byte aimID,
                        byte AimMod,
                        int length,
                        byte[] data)
        This method is used to retrieve all barcode information for each barcode decoded from an image with multiple barcodes This requires multiple callbacks - 1 for each barcode decoded.
        Returns:
        boolean - success

      • getIQImage

        public int getIQImage(IQImagingProperties IQParams,
             android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap)
        This method will capture a bitmap image of the specified Intelligent Image
        Returns:
        int

      • setOCRTemplates

        public void setOCRTemplates(int templates)
        This method is used to set multiple user template definitions for decoding OCR images

      • setOCRUserTemplate

        public void setOCRUserTemplate(int mode,
                      byte[] template)
        This method is used to set a user template definition for decoding OCR images

      • setOCRMode

        public void setOCRMode(int mode)
        This method set the desired OCR decode mode. Refer to the OEM API OCR User’s Guide for more information.

      • waitForDecode

        public void waitForDecode(int timeOut)
        This method is used to start a blocking decode attempt by the scan engine. This function does not return to the calling application until either a symbol is decoded, the time out period has elapsed, or the optional callback function returns a value of false.

      • getCodeID

        public byte getCodeID()
        This method is used to retrieve the CodeID of the last barcode decoded.
        Returns:
        byte value of the codeID

      • getAimID

        public byte getAimID()
        This method is used to retrieve the AimID of the last barcode decoded.
        Returns:
        byte value of the AimID

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        This method is used to retrieve the length of the last barcode decoded.
        Returns:
        integer value of the length

      • getDecodeData

        public java.lang.String getDecodeData()
        This method is used to retrieve the data contained in the last barcode decoded. Should not be used for barcodes containing NULLs or other non-ASCII characters.
        Returns:
        string data of barcode

      • getLastDecodeTime

        public int getLastDecodeTime()
        This method is used to retrieve the duration to decode the last barcode decoded.
        Returns:
        integer value of the time

      • startScanning

        public int startScanning()
        The method causes the image engine to start continuous collecting of images.
        Returns:
        integer - success

      • stopScanning

        public int stopScanning()
        The method causes the image engine to stop continuous collecting of images.
        Returns:
        integer - success

      • getImageWidth

        public int getImageWidth()
        The method is used to retrieve the width (number of pixels) of the last captured image. This information can be used to calculate the image size.
        Returns:
        integer value of the width

      • getImageHeight

        public int getImageHeight()
        The method is used to retrieve the height (number of pixels) of the last captured image. This information can be used to calculate the image size.
        Returns:
        integer value of the height
